text: - [Instructor] Not all XBOX games support

mouse and keyboard, but
most major releases do.

For this tutorial, we'll
be playing Fortnite
on an XBOX series X,

but the settings are the
same for an XBOX One.

First, connect your mouse and
keyboard to the available USB
ports on your XBOX.
If you need more USB ports,
a USB hub might be useful.

When you're within the
XBOX user interface,
your mouse will not work,

but you can use the
keyboard to get around.

I suggest using your Xbox
controller to navigate within the

XBOX user interface and only
use your keyboard and mouse
when playing inside a game.
Open the game you want to play,

you may need to enable
the keyboard and mouse
once in the game,

by going through the
games control settings.
But with Fortnite it's easy.
While in the game lobby,
just click any button on the keyboard,
and you'll see that the button icon switch

from your XBOX controller
to mouse and keyboard.

To switch back, simply begin
using your controller again,

and the game icons will
switch back automatically.

To adjust your mouse pointer
speed while in a game,

click on your XBOX home
button on your controller,

then go to the profile
and system tab at the top,

then click settings, then go
to devices and connections,
then click on mouse.
Here you can adjust your pointer speed
and return to the game and test it out.
(soft music)
